content: We need to remove the counter feature, and Write me an onboarding flow for a luxury chauffeur service app called Gyde, consisting of multiple pages with sliding transitions. Include the following pages, each containing these exact phrases: 1. Welcome page: 'Get Started', 'Experience luxury travel with ease. Register and manage your bookings seamlessly.' 2. Authentication options page: 'Continue with Phone', 'Continue with Email' 3. Phone number input page: 'Add Your Phone', 'Enter your phone number to get yourself verified and ready to start your ride.', 'Phone Number' 4. Verification code page: 'Enter Code', 'We sent verification code to your phone number +65 8123 4567' 5. Email collection page: 'Stay Connected', 'To provide you with tailored services and updates, please share your email with us.', 'Email Address' 6. Welcome confirmation page: 'Welcome Aboard!', 'You've unlocked access to exclusive, personalized chauffeur services with Gyde.', 'Experience comfort, Tailored to your needs' 7. Terms and conditions page: 'By continuing, you have read and agree to our terms and condition.', 'Please read these terms of use carefully before using this platform', 'Welcome to Gyde! By using our services, you agree to the following terms and conditions. Please read them carefully.' Ensure each page has a 'Next' or 'Continue' button to progress through the flow, and use 'Gyde' branding throughout.

content.overview: The application will be transformed from a simple counter app to an onboarding flow for a luxury chauffeur service app called Gyde. This involves removing the counter feature and adding a multi-page onboarding flow with sliding transitions.
new_features: Welcome page with 'Get Started' and description
Authentication options page with 'Continue with Phone' and 'Continue with Email'
Phone number input page with phone number verification prompt
Verification code page with code entry prompt
Email collection page for tailored services
Welcome confirmation page with access confirmation
Terms and conditions page with agreement prompt
modified_features: HomeView to accommodate onboarding flow navigation
removed_features: Counter feature from HomeView and HomeViewModel
content.architectural_changes: Update app.router.dart to include new onboarding routes and transitions. Ensure dependency injection in app.locator.dart supports new services if needed.
cross_cutting_concerns: Ensure consistent branding with 'Gyde' across all new pages
Implement sliding transitions for smooth navigation between onboarding pages
Update navigation logic to handle onboarding flow before accessing main app features

content:
The public interface document has undergone significant changes, primarily focusing on the introduction of an onboarding flow for a luxury chauffeur service app called Gyde. 

1. Additions:
   - New onboarding flow pages have been added, including WelcomeView, AuthOptionsView, PhoneInputView, VerificationCodeView, EmailCollectionView, WelcomeConfirmationView, and TermsConditionsView.
   - New dependencies for these onboarding pages have been added.
   - A new sequence diagram has been added to illustrate the onboarding flow.

2. Removals:
   - The HomeView, StartupView, and their corresponding ViewModel files have been removed.
   - Several dependencies, including 'gap' and 'stacked_services', have been removed from various files.
   - Several methods, such as 'incrementCounter', 'showDialog', 'showBottomSheet', and 'runStartupLogic', have been removed.

3. Changes:
   - The architecture overview now includes the onboarding flow.
   - The file dependencies have been updated to reflect the new onboarding flow.
   - The descriptions of several files have been updated to reflect their new roles in the onboarding flow.
   - The class diagrams for several files have been updated.
   - The navigation flow now starts with the onboarding flow instead of the AppView.
   - The project description now mentions the onboarding flow.
   - The sequence diagram has been updated to reflect the new onboarding flow.
   - The state management flow has been updated, although it still uses the Stacked architecture.

These changes significantly affect the app's structure and functionality, as they introduce a new onboarding flow and remove the previous HomeView and StartupView. The dependencies and methods have been updated to support this new flow.

Create a homepage flow for a luxury chauffeur service app called Gyde that includes: A main rides page with segmented navigation for 'Upcoming', 'Past', and 'Canceled' rides. The header should display the location 'New York, USA' with a Profile icon. Include three service categories: 'Airport Trips', 'Eco Friendly', and 'Shared Rides'. Display a featured chauffeur section titled 'Your Chauffeur (1/1)' showing Edward with a 4.8 rating, 'Online' status, car details (BMW 7 Series), and availability time (Mon - Sat, 09:00 am - 05:00 pm). Include the chauffeur's description: 'Edward is a top-rated driver with a 4.8-star rating, offering premium service with his BMW 7 Series. Available from Monday to Saturday, 9 AM - 5 PM, at $65/hour, he ensures a comfortable and reliable ride for every journey.' Show the Corporate Elite Package with 'Monthly Fee $5000'. For empty states, display: 'You have no upcoming rides', 'You have no past rides', and 'No canceled rides' with the subtitle 'As soon as you book a ride, all of your relevant details will be shown here.' A chauffeur details page showing the profile with car information, availability, and a 'Send Message' button. A profile page displaying user information (John Doe, +65 8123 4567, j.doe@gmail.com) with sections for: 'My Subscriptions', 'Promos', 'Payment Method', 'Change Language', 'Saved Addresses', and 'Notifications'. Include an analytics section showing: Total Spent ($6400), monthly statistics (94 Rides, 10 Rides daily average), and a growth chart indicating '32% this month'. Each page should have a bottom navigation bar with Home, Rides, and Chauffeur tabs. Implement a dark theme design with the status bar showing 9:41, and ensure smooth transitions between all screens.

content.overview: The application will be expanded to include a new homepage flow for the Gyde app, featuring a main rides page with segmented navigation, a featured chauffeur section, a profile page, and a bottom navigation bar. The design will incorporate a dark theme and smooth transitions between screens.
new_features: Main rides page with segmented navigation for 'Upcoming', 'Past', and 'Canceled' rides
Header displaying location 'New York, USA' with a Profile icon
Service categories: 'Airport Trips', 'Eco Friendly', and 'Shared Rides'
Featured chauffeur section titled 'Your Chauffeur (1/1)'
Chauffeur details page with profile, car information, and 'Send Message' button
Profile page displaying user information and sections for 'My Subscriptions', 'Promos', 'Payment Method', 'Change Language', 'Saved Addresses', and 'Notifications'
Analytics section showing Total Spent, monthly statistics, and a growth chart
Bottom navigation bar with Home, Rides, and Chauffeur tabs
Dark theme design with status bar showing 9:41
modified_features: Update app.router.dart to include new routes for the homepage flow
Ensure smooth transitions between all new screens
content.architectural_changes: Enhance the existing Stacked architecture to accommodate new homepage flow components and ensure seamless integration with the existing onboarding flow.
cross_cutting_concerns: Consistent dark theme design across all new and existing pages
Integration of new navigation elements with existing Stacked Router
Ensure consistent branding and user experience across the application

content:
The public interface document has undergone several significant changes:

1. Additions:
   - The architecture overview now includes a homepage flow with a main rides page, a featured chauffeur section, a profile page, and a bottom navigation bar.
   - Three new dependencies have been added: `main_rides_view.dart`, `chauffeur_details_view.dart`, and `profile_view.dart`.
   - The app structure now includes routes for the homepage flow: `MainRidesView`, `ChauffeurDetailsView`, and `ProfileView`.
   - Three new files have been added: `main_rides_view.dart`, `chauffeur_details_view.dart`, and `profile_view.dart`, each with their respective descriptions and dependencies.
   - A new folder structure `lib.features.homepage` has been added with `main_rides_view.dart`, `chauffeur_details_view.dart`, and `profile_view.dart`.
   - The navigation flow now includes access to the main app features through the homepage flow after completing the onboarding flow.
   - The project description now includes a homepage flow for the luxury chauffeur service app.
   - The sequence diagram now includes interactions with `MainRidesView`, `ChauffeurDetailsView`, and `ProfileView`.

2. Removals:
   - Several dependencies have been removed from `files[8].dependencies`, including `flutter/services.dart`, `my_app/app/app.bottomsheets.dart`, `my_app/app/app.dialogs.dart`, `my_app/app/app.locator.dart`, and `my_app/features/onboarding/welcome_view.dart`.
   - The `main` method has been removed from `files[8].methods`.

3. Changes:
   - The `files[8].class_diagram` has been changed from `main` to `MainRidesView`.
   - The `files[8].dependencies[0]` has been changed from `flutter/material.dart` to `stacked/stacked.dart`.
   - The `files[8].description` has been changed to describe the main rides page with segmented navigation.
   - The `files[8].name` has been changed from `lib/main.dart` to `lib/features/homepage/main_rides_view.dart`.

These changes significantly affect the app's structure and functionality, introducing a new homepage flow and modifying dependencies.

The header should display the location 'New York, USA' with a Profile icon. Include three service categories: 'Airport Trips', 'Eco Friendly', and 'Shared Rides'. Display a featured chauffeur section titled 'Your Chauffeur (1/1)' showing Edward with a 4.8 rating, 'Online' status, car details (BMW 7 Series), and availability time (Mon - Sat, 09:00 am - 05:00 pm). Include the chauffeur's description: 'Edward is a top-rated driver with a 4.8-star rating, offering premium service with his BMW 7 Series. Available from Monday to Saturday, 9 AM - 5 PM, at $65/hour, he ensures a comfortable and reliable ride for every journey.' Show the Corporate Elite Package with 'Monthly Fee $5000'. For empty states, display: 'You have no upcoming rides', 'You have no past rides', and 'No canceled rides' with the subtitle 'As soon as you book a ride, all of your relevant details will be shown here.' Each page should have a bottom navigation bar with Home, Rides, and Chauffeur tabs. Implement a dark theme design with the status bar showing 9:41, and ensure smooth transitions between all screens.

content.overview: The modification plan focuses on enhancing the Gyde app by refining the homepage flow, adding new features for better user engagement, and ensuring consistency with the existing design and architecture.
new_features: Add segmented navigation in Main Rides page for 'Upcoming', 'Past', and 'Canceled' rides.
Include a header displaying 'New York, USA' with a Profile icon on the Main Rides page.
Add service categories: 'Airport Trips', 'Eco Friendly', and 'Shared Rides' on the Main Rides page.
Introduce a featured chauffeur section titled 'Your Chauffeur (1/1)' with details about Edward.
Display the Corporate Elite Package with 'Monthly Fee $5000'.
Implement empty states for ride categories with appropriate messages.
Add a chauffeur details page with profile, car information, availability, and a 'Send Message' button.
Enhance the profile page with user information and sections for subscriptions, promos, payment methods, language settings, saved addresses, and notifications.
Include an analytics section in the profile page with total spent, monthly statistics, and a growth chart.
Implement a bottom navigation bar with Home, Rides, and Chauffeur tabs.
Apply a dark theme design across all pages.
modified_features: Refine the Main Rides page to include new segmented navigation and service categories.
Update the Profile page to include new user information sections and analytics.
content.architectural_changes: No major architectural changes are required as the existing Stacked architecture supports the addition of new features and modifications. Ensure that the app.router.dart is updated to include new routes for the homepage flow.
cross_cutting_concerns: Ensure consistent dark theme design across all new and existing pages.
Implement smooth transitions between all screens to maintain a seamless user experience.
Update app.router.dart to manage navigation for new and modified features.
Ensure that all new features adhere to the Stacked architecture for state management and dependency injection.
